Posts.EditableText: Hello everyone, I am one of the old ones (year 2002) who recently resurfaced here. I would like to solicit your ideas towards my making of [i:i5t6mb5p]Posh's New Year's Eve 2[/i:i5t6mb5p]. So give [i:i5t6mb5p]Posh's New Year's Eve[/i:i5t6mb5p] ([url:i5t6mb5p]http://www.textadventures.co.uk/review.php?game=57[/url:i5t6mb5p]) a try and let me me know of anything that crosses your mind...

Posts.EditableText:
Here's a rhetorical question.  Is 'two commands to win' really a bad thing?  I recall a game that was given a good score by someone with a comment saying a tutorial could be written quickly because it only took two commands to win.

Hi OndrejSc, I'll have to look into your game sometime.

[size=150:2e5s5jwq]The official Posh's New Year's Eve Walkthough[/size:2e5s5jwq]
Type the two commands to win
1. Touch posh
then
2. F*** posh (There is a rude word in that command)

I wonder if that helps thousands (maybe fifty) of people playing the game?
